background: A factory uses horse-drawn carts of medium and large sizes to transport rice. Different sizes of carts have varying requirements for horses and capacities for carrying rice.
constraints: Number of medium sized carts is non-negative
Number of large sized carts is non-negative
Total horses used by all carts cannot exceed TotalHorses
Number of medium sized carts must be CartRatio times the number of large sized carts
At least MinimumMediumCarts medium sized carts must be used
At least MinimumLargeCarts large sized carts must be used
objective: Maximize the total amount of rice transported to the city
description: A factory transports rice to the city in horse-drawn carts that are either medium or large size. A medium sized cart requires \param{HorsesPerMediumCart} horses and can carry \param{CapacityMediumCart} kg of rice. A large sized cart requires \param{HorsesPerLargeCart} horses and can carry \param{CapacityLargeCart} kg of rice. The factory has \param{TotalHorses} horses available. Because the horses don't get along well, the number of medium sized carts must be \param{CartRatio} times the number of large sized carts. In addition, there must be at least \param{MinimumMediumCarts} medium sized carts and at least \param{MinimumLargeCarts} large sized carts. How many of each cart size should be used to maximize the amount of rice that can be transported?

parameters.definition: Number of horses required for a medium sized cart
Rice capacity of a medium sized cart
Number of horses required for a large sized cart
Rice capacity of a large sized cart
Minimum number of medium sized carts required
Minimum number of large sized carts required
Ratio of the number of medium sized carts to the number of large sized carts
